ratings.comment: Jiri is interesting some of the time, but really it's hard to make calculus interesting. Decent lecturer if you're good with accents, if you have trouble understanding professors don't choose Jiri. If you read/understand the textbook you'll do fine.... even if you skip most of the lectures

Read the textbook in lecture. His hand-writing and accent are a sort of terrible! However, he is pretty helpful when you have problems. What is even worse is my TA who always make mistake in discussion. If you don't have other choice, take him. If you have, avoid him.
Great professor. Tries to keep class fun and very helpful if you go to office hours.

If you go to lecture, you get the book read to you.  You can open the book, read the example and watch him do them.  Not very helpful.  Also, doesn't go out of his way to help students.  If taking 240, wait for another professor.

This professor rocks! He makes math seem easy because he has so many ways of explaining a new concept. He was also very helpful in office hours. He uses his own book, so you get plenty of practice problems of the kind that will appear on the exam.
